articles.headline: On Election Day, Facebook and Twitter Did Better by Making Their Products Worse
articles.snippet: New rules put in place by the companies over the last four years have helped them avert their greatest fears.
articles.abstract: New rules put in place by the companies over the last four years have helped them avert their greatest fears.
articles.lead_paragraph: That gust of wind you felt coming from Silicon Valley on Wednesday morning was the social media industry’s tentative sigh of relief.

articles.headline: Fox News Meets Trump’s Fraud Claims With Skepticism
articles.snippet: Even “Fox & Friends,” a warm venue for the president, sounded doubts about his talk of a stolen election. CNN and MSNBC dismissed the claims.
articles.abstract: Even “Fox & Friends,” a warm venue for the president, sounded doubts about his talk of a stolen election. CNN and MSNBC dismissed the claims.
articles.lead_paragraph: [Read more on Joe Biden’s president-elect acceptance speech.]
articles.byline: By Tiffany Hsu and John Koblin

articles.headline: The Rise and Fall of the ‘Stop the Steal’ Facebook Group
articles.snippet: In its short life span, it was one of the fastest growing groups in Facebook’s history and a hub for those trying to delegitimize the election.
articles.abstract: In its short life span, it was one of the fastest growing groups in Facebook’s history and a hub for those trying to delegitimize the election.
articles.lead_paragraph: OAKLAND, Calif. — The first post in the new Facebook group that was started on Wednesday was innocuous enough. “Welcome” to Stop the Steal, it said.

articles.headline: A Big Win for Democrats in California Came With a Gut Check for Liberals
articles.snippet: Joe Biden received one of the highest margins in the nation in California, but a look at how the state’s ballot measures were decided shows a more complex picture of the electorate.
articles.abstract: Joe Biden received one of the highest margins in the nation in California, but a look at how the state’s ballot measures were decided shows a more complex picture of the electorate.
articles.lead_paragraph: OAKLAND, Calif. — The message that California voters sent in the presidential election was unequivocal: With almost two-thirds of ballots counted so far going for Joseph R. Biden Jr., the nation’s most populous state put up mammoth numbers for the Democrats. But dig a little deeper into the results and a more complex picture of the Golden State voter emerges, of strong libertarian impulses and resistance to some quintessentially liberal ideas.
articles.byline: By Thomas Fuller, Shawn Hubler, Tim Arango and Conor Dougherty

articles.headline: One Day in America: More Than 121,000 Coronavirus Cases
articles.snippet: Thursday brought more coronavirus infections than in any other day of the pandemic. Around the country, the virus left its mark.
articles.abstract: Thursday brought more coronavirus infections than in any other day of the pandemic. Around the country, the virus left its mark.
articles.lead_paragraph: RACINE, Wis. — They were feverish and desperate, confined to their cars in a slow single-file line as they waited for coronavirus tests.
articles.byline: By Julie Bosman, Audra D. S. Burch and Sarah Mervosh

articles.headline: The Disinformation Is Coming From Inside the White House
articles.snippet: The president and his allies have united right-wing media and internet trolls with false messaging that legitimate vote counting should stop.
articles.abstract: The president and his allies have united right-wing media and internet trolls with false messaging that legitimate vote counting should stop.
articles.lead_paragraph: A disinformation push to subvert the election is well underway, and it is coming straight from President Trump and his allies. The goal: to somehow stop a victory by former Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr., or, failing that, undermine his legitimacy before he can take office.
articles.byline: By Matthew Rosenberg, Jim Rutenberg and Nick Corasaniti

articles.headline: Biden Pulls Ahead in Key States as Anxious Nation Awaits Winner
articles.snippet: Joe Biden picked up votes in Pennsylvania, Nevada and Georgia and urged patience with the slow-moving vote count. President Trump appeared in the evening to break his silence, lying about “illegal” votes.
articles.abstract: Joe Biden picked up votes in Pennsylvania, Nevada and Georgia and urged patience with the slow-moving vote count. President Trump appeared in the evening to break his silence, lying about “illegal” votes.
articles.lead_paragraph: [Joe Biden has won the 2020 U.S. presidential election. Read our story]
articles.byline: By Jonathan Martin and Katie Glueck

articles.headline: As China Casts a Pall Over Hong Kong, Some See Opportunity
articles.snippet: Boosters of growing ties with the mainland see greater business potential. But as the delayed Ant Group I.P.O. shows, peril comes with that promise.
articles.abstract: Boosters of growing ties with the mainland see greater business potential. But as the delayed Ant Group I.P.O. shows, peril comes with that promise.
articles.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — In Hong Kong, a city enveloped in uncertainty, Felix Lee is optimistic about the future. The reason: China.

articles.headline: PlayStation 5 Review: Sony’s New Console Is an Entertaining Behemoth
articles.snippet: With a winning combination of solid hardware and software, Sony’s new console makes us excited about the next generation of gaming.
articles.abstract: With a winning combination of solid hardware and software, Sony’s new console makes us excited about the next generation of gaming.
articles.lead_paragraph: This holiday season, we are faced with a tough quandary: The new PlayStation and Xbox consoles are arriving. Which should we gift to our loved ones — or to ourselves?
articles.byline: By Brian X. Chen and Mike Isaac
